intro: Spiloxene serrata, commonly known as the serrated spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and serrated, giving it its common name. Spiloxene serrata typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and pine flatwoods.
